JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
The applicant , his wife and their CARDINAL children owned a CARDINAL - room apartment , of a total surface area of CARDINAL sq.m . , in a building at CARDINAL FAC , in GPE of GPE .

In DATE the Prefect of the district concluded an investment contract with a private company , “ PERSON ” , for a land development , namely , for the construction of a new housing complex . According to that contract , the building in which the applicant had an apartment had to be pulled down and the inhabitants provided with new apartments .

As the applicant refused to leave the building , in DATE the ORG lodged a claim against him with the NORP ORG of GPE . He claimed that the applicant should be evicted from the apartment in question , his ownership should be terminated and he should be granted ownership of a new apartment in the same district .
On DATE the court rejected the ORG ’s claim .

On DATE ORG issued Decree no . CARDINAL-PP on the Results of the Implementation of a Programme on Dwelling Space in DATE and a ORG in DATE , according to which the building at CARDINAL FAC had to be demolished and its inhabitants relocated .
On DATE the ORG lodged the same claim again .

On DATE the local ORG ( орган опеки и попечительства ) submitted to the court their conclusion that the applicant ’s family ’s eviction and the subsequent granting to them of a new , larger apartment would not affect the interests of the applicant ’s children .
On DATE the ORG issued order no . DATE : “ ... to provide the PERSON family with a CARDINAL - room apartment , of a total surface area of CARDINAL sq.m . , at CARDINAL Lavochkina Street .
On DATE the NORP ORG heard the case in the absence of the applicant ’s family and allowed the ORG ’s claim .
On DATE that judgment was quashed due to the court ’s failure to secure the defendants’ presence and the case was remitted for fresh consideration .
On DATE the NORP ORG of GPE heard the case in the presence of the applicant and his lawyer and found as follows :

“ ... The PERSON family has a CARDINAL - room apartment , of a total surface area of CARDINAL sq.m . , at CARDINAL FAC ... By Decree no . CARDINAL-PP on the Results of the Implementation of a Programme on Dwelling Space in DATE and a ORG in DATE ” the building at LOC is included in the list of buildings to be relocated or demolished . On DATE the Prefect of GPE obliged ORG to provide the inhabitants of the said building with new dwelling space .

Article CARDINAL of the Housing Code provided that , in the event of demolition of a building under circumstances prescribed by law , the local authority should grant the evicted owners title to an equivalent apartment or other compensation ...

By virtue of the ORG ’s order no . DATE the ORG family were provided with a CARDINAL - room apartment , of a total surface area of CARDINAL sq.m . , at CARDINAL FAC . This building is situated in a residential area , in GPE , CARDINAL stops away from the family ’s current location ... In close proximity there are children ’s educational institutions , including a specialist LANGUAGE school ( PERSON is now studying at a similar school ) , music school , and children ’s sports centre .
According to ORG , the market value of the apartment at CARDINAL LOC is MONEY , whereas the market value of the apartment at CARDINAL FAC is MONEY ... ”

Further noting that the authorities were pursuing a public interest and acting within their area of competence , the court allowed the ORG ’s claim and ordered the eviction of the applicant ’s family . The court also terminated the applicant ’s family ’s title to the former apartment and granted them title to the new apartment at CARDINAL FAC . This judgment was subject to immediate execution .
ORG upheld the judgment in full on DATE .
On DATE the applicant ’s family was evicted . On DATE the building was demolished .
Article CARDINAL . Providing citizens who are owners of apartments in a fully or partly privatised building with new apartments due to the demolition of the building

If a building with privatised apartments becomes subject to demolition under circumstances prescribed by law , the local authority , company or organisation that performed the demolition shall grant the evicted owners , upon their agreement , title to an equivalent apartment or other compensation .
